intro: Parnassia palustris, commonly known as the marsh pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its pale yellow flowers with white markings. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating in shallow water. Its flowers bloom in late summer and are pollinated by insects such as bees and flies. Parnassia palustris is often found in bogs and along the margins of ponds and streams.
